data.name: acorns

data.name: astra_guard_note_tw
data.value:
Note from Private Reilly:
Today I was ordered to patrol the Astra facility. McDavid was all panicky about some sabotage attempt or something. “Yeah right” I thought. Anyhow, I fell asleep.

data.name: barracks_andrew_astra2_vo
data.value: As a precaution, we cannot allow Astra to operate without a link to Soma; <until 4.818> otherwise it will pull energy indiscriminately, until it has robbed life from the entire valley, <until 10.124> or even the entire planet. <until 12.136> There should be enough energy within Soma’s auxiliary reserves to sustain the link for years. <until 16.389> However, if the link to Soma is ever disrupted, Astra will need to be shut down immediately. <until 22.389>

data.name: barracks_andrew_disruptplan_vo
data.value: Word has come in of a suspected attempt to sabotage our operations at Area 634. <until 5.125> The report indicates a soldier from the Pathfinder division may have committed himself to treason <until 10.413> by planning to use the Thanatos cannon prototype being developed at Astra to destroy the reactor. <until 16.403> The report came from a colleague of the alleged perpetrator, <until 19.945> suspecting him as a potential Soviet operative. Since we only have one man’s word to go on, <until 25.695> we will need to catch him and any other accomplice in the act. <until 29.675> As such, guards will be posted, discreetly, at Astra. <until 34.600> Nothing will intervene with PENDULUM’s completion <until 38.100>

data.name: barracks_andrew_leaflockup_vo
data.value: In response to the recent sabotage attempt and arrest of the culprits, <until 4.750> I am ordering all Pathfinder operations to be suspended, and all L.E.A.F. suits <until 8.862> locked away until project completion. The suits are too powerful to fall into <until 12.654> the wrong hands. Additionally, I am requesting all evidence of the sabotage attempt, <until 17.982> including Private First Class Edwin Hall’s own L.E.A.F. suit and Ms. King’s recordings, <until 22.829> to be gathered and sent to storage until a proper military tribunal can take place. <until 27.362> Until then, all suspects will remain in detention. <until 30.710> With the recent increase in production, it should not be long. <until 34.229>

data.name: barracks_andrew_wallrun_vo
data.value: Private Hendricks, I’m providing your squad with the newly devised Magnetic Core <until 4.338> for your L.E.A.F. suit so that you may test its limitations. Take your squad to the train <until 9.077> loading dock connecting to the tram tunnel: it should prove an ample testing ground <until 12.924> for this latest upgrade. Report back by the end of the day tomorrow. <until 16.784>

data.name: barracks_edwin_jail_tw
data.value:
Note from Edwin Hall:
I claim responsibility for the sabotage attempt. Virginia King had no role or knowledge of my plan to damage the Astra facility. I deceived her into coming with me to ensure her safety. Please, release her from custody.

data.name: barracks_edwin_note3_tw
data.value:
Note from Edwin Hall to Private Gregory:
Great job out there today, you smoked those Raptor goons on the timing run. Keep it up buddy.

data.name: barracks_edwin_sabotage_tw
data.value:
Letter from Edwin Hall to Virginia King:
I think you’re insane for doing this, but I don’t think I can stop you… The best way to do this is tomorrow night during the guard shift switch. No matter what, we cannot allow ourselves to get caught.

data.name: barracks_edwin_virginia_tw
data.value:
Letter from Edwin Hall to Virginia King:
Please don’t go through with this. This is the army we’re talking about, during a war. They’ll execute you if do anything they consider traitorous. I can’t bear that thought. Listen to me, I know the things they’re doing are vile to say the least, but is it worth risking your life over? Please, Virginia, reconsider this.

data.name: barracks_guard_icerink_tw
data.value:
Note from a soldier:
Hey Lenny,
It gets pretty frigid out here in winter, eh? What do you say we build ourselves an ice rink out behind the barracks? Get some makeshift skates and some hockey sticks and have our own tournament.

data.name: barracks_guard_interrogation_tw
data.value:
Report from a guard:
Edwin Hall, Pathfinder, Private First Class. Conceded guilt in regards to sabotage attempt. Claims full responsibility and denies Virginia King’s involvement. Denial of espionage or collusion with foreign governments.

data.name: barracks_guard_interrogation_vo
data.value: Guard: July 29th, 1945, <until 3.525> Interrogating suspects involved in the attempted sabotage. <until 6.686> Listen, just be up front with us. Are you Soviet spies? <until 10.183> Virginia: No, for the last time. This has nothing to do with politics! <until 14.130> Guard: Alright, alright calm down. Just tell us your reasons. <until 16.746> Virginia: You know how insane Fisher has become! He’s willing to destroy this entire valley to- <until 22.716> <until 26.889> Guard: What the hell was that? <until 28.500>

data.name: barracks_guard_note2_tw
data.value:
Note from Private Sparks:
Corporal McDavid ordered me to run laps around the barracks for sleeping on duty again. That guy’s a real pain if you ask me. Everyone was watching, so I tried to play it cool and pretend I was running around the barracks by choice. It seemed to be working until I vomited.

data.name: barracks_lieutenant_reprimand_tw
data.value:
Note from a lieutenant:
Private Lenny Watts has been reprimanded for conspiring to waste valuable resources and manpower to produce an ice rink. He will be cleaning cafeteria dishes for the next 4 weeks. It is not yet known who else was involved.

data.name: barracks_memo_alert_tw
data.value:
Memo:
Please be on alert for any suspicious activity. With the recent revelation of espionage within our ranks, utmost precaution must be practiced.

data.name: barracks_mp_report_tw
data.value:
Investigative Report:
Private Matthews, a soldier from the Pathfinder division, has come forward with suspicions that Private First Class Edwin Hall may be attempting to sabotage Area 634 operations. He claims to have disclosed a method to destroy both facilities at once using a weapon devised at Astra, unaware of Hall’s intent. Fearful of the consequences due to his complicity, he has come forward with this startling information. Aside from his word, however, we have no evidence to corroborate his allegations.

data.name: barracks_pathfinder_pyramid_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
I think we almost have enough medallions to get into that ancient pyramid near Astra. Word has it the Raptor squad is picking up pace, so we need to work fast.

data.name: barracks_pathfinder_traitor_tw
data.value:
Report from Private Matthews:
I suspect my squadmate, Edwin Hall, may be plotting some sort of method to use that weapon being built at Astra to stir up some trouble. He keeps asking me questions, though I don’t know much about it. I see him wandering through Astra every now and then, even though that sector isn’t part of his patrol. I’ve known him for some time now, but the way he’s been acting lately has me on edge.

data.name: barracks_pathfinder_winter_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
I miss the winter months up here. Nothing beats running on the snow with those snowshoe attachments on my L.E.AF. suit. Sliding down hills, gliding on ice, and just sitting back to watch the daemons chase snowflakes are some of my favorite memories from this place.

data.name: barracks_player_astra
data.value: Astra will keep sucking life into it without Soma?

data.name: barracks_player_astrakilling
data.value: Astra is slowly killing everything...

data.name: barracks_player_caught
data.value: Were they caught?

data.name: barracks_player_creatureastra
data.value: Could that have something to do with these creatures?

data.name: barracks_player_creatures
data.value: What the hell are these creatures?

data.name: barracks_player_creatures2
data.value: Where did these creatures come from?

data.name: barracks_player_flood
data.value: This place is flooding fast...

data.name: barracks_player_isthatastra
data.value: That must be Astra...

data.name: barracks_player_stopit
data.value: It needs to be shut down...

data.name: barracks_player_tipple
data.value: Maybe I can access the tram tunnel from the train dock...

data.name: barracks_player_tram
data.value: That tunnel can take me to Astra...

data.name: barracks_player_virginia
data.value: Virginia...

data.name: barracks_player_virginiaoffice
data.value: Virginia's office...

data.name: barracks_player_virginiastra
data.value: Did Virginia try to stop Astra?

data.name: barracks_researcher_armory_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The L.E.A.F. suit Mark I proved successful in its capacity to manipulate amrita energy on a small, mobile scale. The Mark II saw the addition of pilot amrita infusion and stronger protective plating to the thighs. Mark III research and development is still underway.

data.name: barracks_researcher_balance_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The Soma and Astra facility are held in a delicate balance. While Astra ‘takes’, Soma ‘gives’. The two are interlocked with each other, kind of like a yin yang. In order to produce bombs, we need an external source of energy to inject into the system to pass through the Lifeseed acting as an amplifier and outputted as weapon grade fuel.
I have to admit, I’m a little afraid to be working with such a delicate and dangerous system. But I’m certain the bombs we're building out of it will put an immediate end to warfare forever.

data.name: barracks_researcher_dodos_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The sprites, or “daemons”, of this valley are so incredibly friendly and fearless. They remind me of dodo birds. I hope these little guys don’t face the same fate as a result of their naivety.

data.name: barracks_researcher_ecosystem_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
How delicate is the ecosystem in the valley? What role do the daemons play within it? As Astra pulls in more and more life energy, it seems as though we’re risking permanently destroying the balance of this ecosystem. Is that the price for victory in the war? I should probably keep these thoughts to myself.

data.name: barracks_researcher_rampup_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
I can’t believe we’re ramping up production, this seems suicidal. I hope they know what they are doing. I think we’re going to end up killing everything in this valley.

data.name: barracks_researcher_virginia_tw
data.value:
Letter from an anonymous researcher to Virginia King:
Virginia, I know of a way to use that cannon you mentioned to disrupt the project. It may sound crazy, but it’s worth a shot. Something needs to be done as soon as possible. Not only are we risking our own lives out here, we’re endangering this entire valley, if not the world. Meet me tomorrow night near the step pyramid just past dusk. Make sure no one sees you.

data.name: barracks_soldier_note_tw
data.value:
Note from a soldier:
The isolation policy here is pretty damn extreme. I haven’t had any communication with my family in months. For some of the guys, it’s been years. How is my wife doing? Are my parents in good health? Did my brother ever get sent off to Europe? I can’t wait until this is all over.

data.name: barracks_soldier_note2_tw
data.value:
Note from a soldier:
No one believes me that there’s something down inside that giant colossus head. I swear I heard something in there, something that wasn’t human. I could feel it watching me. There’s no way I’m going into that thing at night again.

data.name: barracks_virginia_anthropology_tw
data.value:
M.1003.311.468
Stone Door
Possible Wendigo depiction

data.name: barracks_virginia_anthropology1_tw
data.value:
M.1287.117.511
Large vase
Possible depiction of World Turtle

data.name: barracks_virginia_anthropology2_tw
data.value:
M.1167.367.798
Clay pottery
Ornate designs indicative of fine ware

data.name: barracks_virginia_destruction_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
How simple is it to abuse this valley for the sake of building weapons? It’s so easy to destroy…but creation, that’s what advances civilizations. Where would the Romans be if all their inventions were solely for warfare? We think too small. If we think only of the war, what cost will we pay down the road? The next battle, the next war; what about the next generation?

data.name: barracks_virginia_destruction_vo
data.value: N/A Removed

data.name: barracks_virginia_family_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
As much as I love this valley, the thought of returning home with Edwin makes me so happy.

data.name: barracks_virginia_jail_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
To whoever may find this, please stop Pendulum at any cost. Andrew Fisher has gone mad and won’t stop short of harming this planet to satisfy his pride. Do anything you can to disrupt this project before they destroy the entire valley. There’s nothing I can do now.

data.name: barracks_virginia_plan_vo
data.value: They won’t listen. The energy they’re demanding <until 3.848> from the valley is far outpacing whatever can be produced from the orbs. <until 8.023> It’s killing this place… and we'll lose it forever if we don't do something. <until 14.623> Edwin may try to stop me; <until 17.203> I’ll no doubt be charged with treason if I’m caught... <until 20.793> maybe even executed. But this is larger than me; <until 25.969> this valley…it could very well change the world. I have to save it before it’s lost forever. <until 35.379>

data.name: barracks_virginia_tram_vo
data.value: Edwin’s reluctantly agreed to help, if only to make sure nothing happens to me. <until 7.630> One of his squad mates mentioned to him a weapon being built at Astra…some sort of cannon. <until 14.450> We should be able to use it to destroy Astra beyond reparation; <until 19.160> enough to shut down this project. Unfortunately everyone is working round the clock <until 25.439> with the increase in production, so we’ll need to pull an alarm to get everyone out. <until 30.550> We can then sneak into Astra through the underground tram tunnel <until 34.855> that connects the two sites. No one should get hurt...or hopefully caught. <until 42.675> To whom ever may find this recording, please understand that Fisher <until 48.714> has strayed beyond reason. If we don’t put a stop to this madness, <until 53.319> they could destroy this valley, and with power like this, maybe even the world. <until 60.497> If we’ve failed, please do whatever it takes to stop them before it’s too late. <until 67.187>

data.name: barracks_worker_complaining_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
Those damn Pathfinders keep getting in the way of our loading. The way they run around on these walls, training for who knows what, they think they own this place. Well I have a job to do, and I’ll be damned if these brash young men put me behind schedule.

data.name: barracks_worker_tower_tw
data.value:
Memo:
Isolation Policy in effect. All aircraft to remain grounded until policy is lifted following project completion. Any aircraft attempting to leave the site will be taken down through aggressive measures.

data.name: barracks_worker_tunnels_tw
data.value:
Memo from an engineer:
Please be cautious when traveling through the utility tunnels. Listen and watch for possible signs of collapse. The load bearing beams appear to be warping under the stress of the mountain weight. Crews will be sent out weekly to monitor tunnel integrity.

data.name: choose_voice
data.value: Choose A Gender

data.name: cliff_andrew_hookshot_vo
data.value: The Viper Coil upgrade to the L.E.A.F. suit <until 2.064> allows Pathfinders to grapple onto certain target points within a limited range, <until 6.824> allowing them to reach areas where jumps prove insufficient. <until 10.886> For testing purposes, the Viper Coil is currently limited to particular targets. <until 15.440>

data.name: cliff_engineer_craneblocks_tw
data.value:
Note from an engineer:
Ever since the Pathfinder program decided to use the deadeye crane blocks as part of their training, my engineers have been consistently putting themselves in harm’s way to set them up. One poor fellow tragically fell to his death while stringing up a deadeye across a chasm.
We don’t even get to wear a damn L.E.A.F. suit, otherwise he may have lived. What a waste.

data.name: cliff_guard_note_tw
data.value:
Note from Private Sparks:
McDavid’s been riding me again. It’s like a guy can’t take a nap anymore these days. Sure, I was on guard duty at the time, but what am I guarding against? There’s nothing out here.
Yesterday I saw a rabbit run by. It was the highlight of my day.

data.name: cliff_intercom_approachfacility_vo
data.value: Only authorized personnel are permitted on the premise. In accordance with the War Measures Act, <until 5.371> extreme security screening and clearance is in effect. <until 8.284> All personnel entering cargo bay require appropriate badge identification. <until 12.664>

data.name: cliff_memo_somamemo_tw
data.value:
Reminder to all personnel:
Please keep a safe distance away from Amrita Swarms. They often become territorially aggressive when in need of amrita. If a swarm is blocking access for you, please request for a Pathfinder to pacify the swarm.

data.name: cliff_pathfinder_bear_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
Everyone here thinks I’m a liar. No one believes I got attacked by a grizzly bear during one of my runs. Luckily I managed to extract its life before it could swipe at my face!
I got real far before turning back to return its life energy. Hope I never see the likes of him again.

data.name: cliff_pathfinder_death_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
Dying while wearing the L.E.A.F. suit is an incredible experience. No one outside myself can possibly observe it. The best way I can describe it is as a day dream one sometimes gets lost in. I die by falling into a lake, and the next second I’m standing by the shore, no one else being the wiser about what just happened to me. Is it even real?

data.name: cliff_pathfinder_exploringdoors_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
We’ve got a large portion of this valley mapped out so far. As far as I know, we’ve explored most of the acorn doors. I hear there are a couple squads with almost enough medallions to access that big step pyramid.

data.name: cliff_pathfinder_pyramid_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
These medallions are getting cleaned up fast. Getting into that pyramid first is gonna be tough. Hopefully I find some more quick; I want to be the first to explore it.

data.name: cliff_player_abandoned
data.value: Where did everyone go?

data.name: cliff_player_amritatanks
data.value: Amrita storage?

data.name: cliff_player_lifeseed
data.value: Did he know about the Lifeseed?

data.name: cliff_player_lifeseed2
data.value: How long has this been abandoned?

data.name: cliff_player_pathfinder
data.value: Did Pathfinders train here?

data.name: cliff_player_power
data.value: These lights still have power...

data.name: cliff_player_whathappened
data.value: What happened to everyone?

data.name: cliff_researcher_squads_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Pathfinder squad point tally from the daily exercises:
Landsharks: 48 Raptors: 43 Valkryies: 37 Buckriders: 37 Wild Roses: 29

data.name: cliff_soldier_sighting_tw
data.value:
Memo:
Stay on the lookout for any intruders on the premises. A number of guards have reported seeing shadowy figures watching our operations from afar. It could be a sign of possible espionage. Report trespasser sightings at once.

data.name: cliff_virginia_footprint_vo
data.value: While I appreciate being brought in to study the valley, <until 3.450> I wish the military’s presence here wasn’t so…domineering. <until 8.760> I can’t say these giant structures add much to the view. <until 13.020> It would be nice if this was simply a place of study and conservation. <until 17.612> I’m doing my best to steer the army away from the ruins, <until 20.108> but the only thing that seems to concern them is their project, <until 24.775> gathering up as many of these strange orbs as they possibly can. <until 28.685>

data.name: cliff_virginia_hiddenvalley_vo
data.value: // N/A Removed

data.name: cliff_virginia_isolated_vo
data.value: As lonely as it’s been with the isolation policy in effect, I’ve often found myself in the company <until 6.276> of a Pathfinder named Edwin Hall. The things he can do in a L.E.A.F. suit are astounding. <until 15.047> Some nights we’ll head to the rooftop above my office and watch the auroras. <until 21.157> I have no idea what he could possibly see in me though… I tend to ramble a lot. <until 27.547> I mean, who wouldn’t find Mesoamerican calendrical systems anything other than fascinating? <until 34.317> Guys love that stuff! Right…? <until 38.177>

data.name: cliff_virginia_lamentation_vo
data.value: While I appreciate being brought in to study the valley, <until 4.300> I wish the military’s presence here wasn’t so… <until 8.493> domineering. <until 10.410> I feel pity for this once pristine valley. <until 15.020> This should be a place of study and conservation… <until 19.273> not some twisted experiment. <until 22.00> We have no right interfering in such a delicate ecosystem. <until 27.492>

data.name: cliff_virginia_samsara_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
Samsara: the repeating cycle of birth, life and death, affected by the karma fostered during one’s life. Is that what Pathfinders experience, constantly dying and reviving? According to Buddhism there is no beginning to this cycle but it can, however, be broken through enlightenment.

data.name: cliff_virginia_susurrus_vo
data.value:
//no Audio File
Area 634, Ainihkiwa, Site 39B- we have so many different names for this valley. I have my own word for it: Susurrus. The beauty of that word seems to rival the majesty of this place. It seems fitting given the calm and soothing nature of the breeze. Susurrus- that’s what I think when I lie in the moss and look up at the clouds floating by, carried by the breeze I hear as it weaves through trees and blades of grass. It’s perfect!

data.name: cliff_virginia_valleydiscovery_vo
data.value: From what I’ve been told, <until 1.380> Susurrus was discovered back in 1811 by a surveyor seeking to map this remote region. <until 7.802> No one believed what he reportedly saw. Due to the sheer remoteness of the region, <until 14.222> his story was written off as the senile delusions of an old man, and his tale was soon forgotten. <until 21.802> It was not until recently that the government was approached by a scientist named Andrew Fisher <until 26.937> to use this location as an alternative energy project of some sort. <until 31.779> How he came to discover this place is beyond me. <until 35.399>

data.name: cliff_worker_colossi_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
Those colossi statues all over this valley are a bit… unnerving. Why would the ancient people who lived here build that kind of stuff? As scary as they are, I still find there is a beauty to them. Something about those monstrous faces sitting amongst the calm forest captures an odd sense of allure.

data.name: cliff_worker_mountainside_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
Working the pipes on this place is a real pain. It’s as though they went out of their way to build their facility in the worst place imaginable, just to make it tough on lowly pipefitters like me. Repairing a pressure system leak takes me the half of a day just to get to it!
They ain’t paying me enough if you ask me.

data.name: death_screen_description
data.value: Não há energia suficiente para reviver você mesmo

data.name: death_screen_map
data.value: Começar do Mapa

data.name: death_screen_menu
data.value: Retornar ao Menu Principal

data.name: death_screen_restart
data.value: Reiniciar Nível

data.name: death_screen_title
data.value: O Vale está morto

data.name: delete_slot_description
data.value: Seu save slot no momento está sendo apagado. Por favor Aguarde...

data.name: delete_slot_title
data.value: Apagando Slot...

data.name: facility_andrew_final_vo
data.value: With the combined power of both Thanatos and the Brahmastra bomb, <until 4.960> the power to control the world will lie within the hands of a small few, <until 9.475> every nation on Earth will tremble in fear- <until 14.000>

data.name: facility_andrew_regret_vo
data.value: There’s no escape… everyone, they’re… they’re all getting killed by these things, these creatures. <until 7.543> If anyone ever hears this, please understand. Please understand what we were doing here- <until 12.298> the things we created! The world must see our achievements! <until 15.472> Our work will change the course of human history! Whoever holds this technology <until 21.358> holds the world in their hands. Remember what I accomplished… <until 26.200>

data.name: facility_andrew_thanatos_vo
data.value: Since we had to catch the saboteurs in the act, <until 2.869> we allowed them access into the Astra facility during their night of attack. <until 7.030> Admittedly, their plan was rather genius- since Astra and Soma are linked, <until 11.851> they intended to fire the Thanatos cannon connected to Astra’s thermal storage <until 15.676> at the Soma facility’s energy reservoir to create a feedback loop of amplifying intensity <until 20.255> until the system blows out, not unlike a microphone to a speaker. <until 24.985>

data.name: facility_andrew_thanatos2_vo
data.value: We had temporarily removed the Lifeseed from the Soma reactor necessary for the amplification, <until 5.220> thus creating a harmless feedback loop when they attempted to fire Thanatos. <until 10.240> Without the Lifeseed, their plan was doomed to fail from the beginning. <until 14.778> I will NOT tolerate any more disruptions! We have lost too much ground to Manhattan! <until 21.043> Operations will resume exponentially- if the orbs will not suffice, <until 25.886> then we’ll use the damn valley itself! <until 28.936>

data.name: facility_andrew_waterrun_vo
data.value: I’ve tasked the Valkyrie pathfinder squad with <until 2.504> testing out the Lake Skipper upgrade for the L.E.A.F. suit. <until 5.363> The lake near the Astra Facility should prove ideal for the assessment. <until 9.262> I expect a full report on my desk as soon as testing is complete. <until 12.702>

data.name: facility_andrew_wmds_vo
data.value: The bomb…it’s only the beginning. <until 3.480> Imagine a weapon of mass destruction without the structural damage incurred. <until 7.820> By extrapolating the mechanics of the L.E.A.F. suit’s God Hand to a larger scale, <until 12.071> I have devised a weapon capable of stripping all life from cities, even entire nations, <until 17.851> when used with the Lifeseed! The Thanatos cannon <until 20.979> will be the optimal super weapon, rendering all others obsolete! <until 26.882> These bombs we’re all competing to produce will look paltry in comparison! <until 32.500>

data.name: facility_engineer_astrasomalink_tw
data.value:
Note from an engineer:
The Thanatos cannon has been linked to the amrita reservoir so that the energy it draws can be stored. Excess amrita is burned off through flare stacks. If too much amrita enters the reservoirs too quickly, the flare stacks will not be able to burn it off quickly enough once the reservoirs fill, let alone once it gets amplified when passing through the Lifeseed at Soma. Luckily, we have ample amounts of water from Smoke Lake to pump into Astra in case of emergency meltdown.

data.name: facility_fisher_brahmastra_tw
data.value:
Note from Andrew Fisher:
The Bhramastra will be the greatest bomb the world has ever seen. I should be able to gather enough amrita energy to produce a 100 megaton bomb. Can you imagine? Every nation on Earth will tremble before this unprecedented weapon.

data.name: facility_intercom_astrawelcome_vo
data.value: // N/A Removed

data.name: facility_intercom_cooling_vo
data.value: // N/A Removed

data.name: facility_intercom_emergencyexit_vo

data.name: facility_researcher_alpha_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Some researchers have reported spotting an Alpha daemon in the field. Though unverified, the reports indicate a larger form with elongated antlers. Until more evidence is provided, its existence will remain conjectural.

data.name: facility_researcher_amrita_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Good thing we have these amrita fuel slugs around. I’m a bit worried to go outside with the Astra facility going into full production. It seems to be killing the environment around it. Maybe if I had a L.E.A.F. suit I’d be a little braver, but for now I’ll stick close to energy reserves.

data.name: facility_researcher_astradanger_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
If production is not slowed down soon, there won’t be much amrita energy left to draw from the Valley. I think this places our own personnel in danger. Fisher is hell-bent on trumping Oppenheimer, I don’t think this is a good idea.

data.name: facility_researcher_battleship_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Assuming the Thanatos prototype proves successful, the weapon will be mobilized by placing it upon the deck of a battleship, or more ideally, an aircraft carrier as in order to increase the cannon's range it must be elevated to a high vantage point; otherwise its use will be limited to the coastline.
If the Project Habakkuk ice carrier prototype proves successful, we should be able to mount a high enough shaft with which to raise Thanatos upon its unprecedented massive hull.

data.name: facility_researcher_bomb1_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The Brahmastra is the ultimate tool of destruction. While the Thanatos does no structural damage, the Brahmastra will obliterate anything in its wake. The implications extend beyond military use. Entire mountains can be erased from existence to make way for development, canals can be instantly created to build new shipping lanes. We could have created the Panama Canal in a single day!

data.name: facility_researcher_bomb2_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
With amrita fuel, we can manufacture weapons at a rate quicker than any single nation engaged in total war. Not to mention the cheap cost to produce: Astra can pull from any life source deemed necessary to produce bombs of any caliber.

data.name: facility_researcher_specimen 1_tw
data.value: Specimen 001 Has undergone vivisection to explore amrita extraction techniques. After extraction of 5 Watts the specimen ceased all vital signs.

data.name: facility_researcher_specimen 2_tw
data.value: Specimen 006 Has been starved of raw amrita energy for 54 days before eventually dying.

data.name: facility_researcher_specimen 3_tw
data.value: Specimen 027 Vivisection of specimen 027 resulted in death minutes after the removal of its facial mask component.

data.name: facility_researcher_specimen 5_tw
data.value: Specimen 053 Specimen died immediately following a test of resistance to radiation bombardment.

data.name: facility_researcher_specimen 6_tw
data.value: Specimen 176 Dissection has demonstrated evidence of an amrita-based neuron system.

data.name: facility_researcher_specimen 7_tw
data.value: Specimen 200 managed to generate 1KW before its heart gave out. This specimen is the result of selective breeding and use of amrita compound X7.

data.name: facility_researcher_sprite1_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Typical instruments were unable to puncture the specimen until the discovery of the amrita blade. Amrita energy contains the ability to cross into the ethereal creature’s phase.

data.name: facility_researcher_sprite2_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Tests on specimen 047 have revealed that amrita beta-particles are the cause of its seeming levitation. Unfortunately the charged particles have a half-life of 1 picosecond and are not fit for harvesting.

data.name: facility_researcher_sprite3_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Advances in mid-air propulsion have been made by charging amrita nuclei and firing beta-particles. Sustained propulsion does not appear possible.

data.name: facility_researcher_sprite4_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Vivisection of specimen 087 cost the lives of two researchers when the circulatory system was pumped with amrita compound X7 in an attempt to measure storage capacity. The resulting explosion has shown us that a mass of amrita can draw energy from its surroundings

data.name: facility_researcher_sprite5_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Amrita appears to act like an element of the periodic table yet its entire make-up is much more complex like that of a molecule. Its nucleus contains protons and neutrons in an obscure lattice formation. As the nucleus rotates, certain protons and neutrons appear and re-appear akin to a four dimensional tesseract.

data.name: facility_scientist_bomb_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The Thanatos Cannon exceeds all efficiencies demonstrated by the bombs. Thanatos can induce the same level of casualties, but retain all infrastructures. Thanatos should render large scale explosives for warfare nearly obsolete. This could be the weapon to end all weapons.

data.name: facility_virginia_andrew_orbs_vo
data.value: Fisher: August 16th, 1944. The latest increase in- <until 5.087> Virginia: You knew about this the entire time didn’t you?!? <until 7.900> Fisher: Ms. King, please. <until 9.169> Virginia: How could you?! They’re living creatures! <until 11.718> Fisher: You have no idea what’s at stake here. <until 14.136> Virginia: They’re embryos! The orbs you’ve been using are daemon eggs! <until 19.020> What you’re doing here is sickening! Fisher : Guards! <until 21.952>

data.name: facility_virginia_andrew_tw
data.value:
Letter from Virginia King to Andrew Fisher:
I beg of you Fisher, Pendulum must reduce production immediately to mitigate its detrimental environmental effects. The world has the right to experience this place, and we will lose it if nothing is done.

data.name: facility_virginia_blindmen_vo
data.value: Am I any closer to unlocking the secrets of this valley? <until 5.140> What are the Susurrians trying to communicate through these colossal statues? <until 10.678> The Titan Tree, the daemons, and the colossi they all intertwine to form a mythology. <until 18.340> From what I can tell, the colossi were once humans who feasted upon <until 22.392> the fruit of the forbidden tree, corrupting them into monstrosities- <until 26.336> cannibalizing their fellow man and devouring all life within the valley. <until 31.044> No surprise there- <until 32.994> the forbidden fruit of a sacred tree is common in mythologies. <until 37.519> Is this a tale of caution? <until 40.439>

data.name: facility_virginia_blindmen2_vo
data.value: What truly baffles me is where the daemons fit- <until 4.370> apparently considered wardens of the valley, <until 7.130> rising up to destroy the colossi- <until 9.350> returning the life that was stolen, back to the valley. <until 12.980> But that doesn’t make too much sense- <until 16.490> how could these cute little daemons attack, <until 19.627> let alone defeat, these giant monsters? <until 22.927>

data.name: facility_virginia_valleymusic_vo
data.value: // N/A Removed

data.name: female_voice_selection
data.value: Female

data.name: field_edwin_exploring_tw
data.value:
Note from Edwin Hall:
It’s nice to get away sometimes. There are so many hidden areas in this valley; I sometimes like to find a nice, quiet spot to sit and gather my thoughts. This place has changed my life.
From meeting Virginia, to coming to understand what’s important in my life, I’m not the same man I was first coming in here. Virginia taught me to see the beauty of the world, and now that my eyes are open I see it everywhere.

data.name: field_edwin_love_tw
data.value: My beautiful Virginia, Thank you so much for the photograph, there’s nothing I love more than starting each morning with a glimpse of your beautiful smile. I suppose I should return the favor. Meet me near the training camp after dark tonight, tonight’s full moon should offer some romantic lighting at the lakeshore.

data.name: field_edwin_note1_tw
data.value:
Note from Edwin Hall:
I’m taking Virginia up to the rooftop again tonight. Everything that’s going on with Pendulum… I need to take her mind off of things. Since she doesn’t drink wine, I’ll see about sneaking some carbonated punch up with us.

data.name: field_edwin_pathfinders_tw
data.value:
Letter from Edwin Hall to Virginia King:
The Landsharks are competing against the Raptors today. They’re fast, agile and a little overconfident but I’m sure we can beat them. That all depends on how our new recruit holds up. I hope you’ll be cheering us on today.
Wish me luck!

data.name: field_pathfinder_pyramid_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
Pooled together, the Valkyries only have half as many medallions as we need to access the step pyramid. I hear the Raptors are a good chunk of the way there. But my money’s on the Landsharks being the first to enter it.

data.name: field_player_cannibals
data.value: Giant cannibals?

data.name: field_player_cavein
data.value: Looks like it's caved in...

data.name: field_player_cavein2
data.value: I'll have to find another way

data.name: field_player_craters
data.value: This must be where they started testing bombs

data.name: field_player_leafsuit
data.value: So no one had access to L.E.A.F. suits...

data.name: field_player_wendigo
data.value: Wendigos?

data.name: field_virginia_ancients_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
By my calculations, the natives who inhabited this land vanished several centuries ago. What happened to them? Where did they come from? Why did they come here? The soil is not ideal for agriculture. The best I can reason is that this must have been sacred ground for them.

data.name: field_virginia_aztecs_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
As baffling as these ancient ruins are, I see hints of other civilizations hiding within them. The Aztecs believed that life came from the gods sacrificing themselves. They produced the sustenance that nourishes life, and a great on-going sacrifice continues to sustain the universe.
They believed that everything springs from the severed bodies, limbs and heads of these sacrificed gods; while humanity itself are those deserved and brought back to life through penance. It’s quite possible we’re witnessing reflections of these beliefs here within the valley.

data.name: field_virginia_collossus_vo
data.value: April 24th, 1943 <until 2.968> What is the significance behind these colossal statues found throughout the valley? <until 8.588> I find they all look so very...voracious. <until 13.238> I keep returning to the idea of the mythical Si-Te-Cah, <until 17.199> the legendary tribe of cannibalistic giants that roamed North America <until 21.129> and came into conflict with the aboriginals. But why would they be worshipped here? <until 26.473> There must be something else to it… <until 28.633>

data.name: field_virginia_edwinmeet_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
When Edwin and I met…it was nothing short of magical, and okay, pretty embarrassing too. So I was hiking through the woods, searching for an ancient sunken village I suspected was nearby. I could see something beneath the surface of this lake, and I climbed a tree to get a broader view (note to self, don’t try to climb trees anymore). But upon nearing the top, I snapped a branch and plummeted towards the ground. Thank goodness for Edwin, if he wasn’t passing by in just that moment… I think owe him my life.

data.name: field_virginia_edwinmeet_vo
data.value:
//N/A Removed
April 24th, 1943 When Edwin and I met…it…it was nothing short of magical. I was hiking through the woods, searching for an ancient sunken village I suspected was nearby and ventured into the Pathfinder training area. I could see something beneath the surface of the lake, so I climbed a tree to get a broader view. But upon nearing the top, I snapped a branch and plummeted towards the ground! Thank goodness for Edwin- if he wasn’t passing by in just that moment… I owe him my life.

data.name: field_virginia_introspection_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
I’ve always found water to be so mesmerizing. Watching the currents flow, and the bubbles form. What better way to sit and reflect on my time here? I’ll certainly miss it when this is all over. I’ve changed so much since I first arrived. Like Heraclitus said, “No man could walk through the same river twice, as the man and the river have since changed.” And how true it is! Every day I am reborn, both physically and mentally. It’s like we’re being constantly reincarnated, born out of this world the same way a wave is born out of the water, forming and dissipating back to its flow. These fleeting moments of life… it makes me cherish these beautiful times, the warm sun bathing my skin and that wind moving across my body; running through the grass, laughing.

data.name: field_virginia_introspection_vo
data.value:
// N/A Removed
I’ve always found water to be so mesmerizing. Watching the currents flow, or the bubbles form. What better way to sit and reflect on my time here? I’ll certainly miss it when this is all over. I’ve changed so much since I first arrived. The things I’ve learned, the things I’ve seen. The man I love. Like Heraclitus said, “No man could walk through the same river twice, as the man and the river have since changed.” And how true it is! Every day I am reborn, both physically and mentally! It’s like we’re being consistently reincarnated, born out of this world the same way a wave is born out of the water, forming and dissipating back to its flow. These fleeting moments of life… it makes me cherish these beautiful times: that warm sun bathing my skin and that wind moving across my body; running through the grass, laughing! As the Romans say, what’s more important than to live, laugh…and love?

data.name: field_virginia_nest_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
One thing that’s always perplexed me regarding the sprites is where exactly they go to sleep. Surely they must have a den somewhere near here. They’re incredibly hard to follow…if only Edwin would lend me his L.E.A.F. suit. Who am I kidding? I can’t run half a mile, let alone half a valley.

data.name: field_virginia_nest_vo
data.value: //N/A Removed Virginia King, audio journal, June 4th 1941. Shortly after the outbreak of war in Europe, I was enlisted by the army to study the history of this valley. While the military is busy working on their research and development project, I’ve been studying the anthropological history of this hidden place. The little forest sprites seem to be the last living remnants of the long lost culture that once lived here. Were they domesticated? What role do they play in the ecosystem? A large number of them seem to inhabit the North-East sector of the valley, just past the ruins where the Lifeseed was found. That’s as good a place of any to study them.

data.name: field_virginia_sacrifice_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
Like countless other civilizations, many Mesoamericans also believed in reincarnation. This meant no body burning, as the body’s vital force must be preserved. The Aztecs believed that our hearts were a fragment of the sun, a piece of the cosmos trapped within each of us. Human sacrifice was seen as repaying the debt of life owed back to the universe. Was that what they were doing here? A sacrificial restitution to the earth?

data.name: field_virginia_sacrifice_vo
data.value:
// N/A Removed
Like countless other civilizations, many Mesoamericans also believed in reincarnation. This meant no body burning, as the body’s vital force must be preserved. The Aztecs believed that our hearts were a fragment of the sun, a piece of the cosmos trapped within each of us. Human sacrifice was seen as repaying the debt of life owed back to the universe. Was that what they were doing here? A sacrificial restitution to the earth? The biggest sacrifice I’ve ever made was giving up ice cream. I don’t think they would count that.

data.name: field_virginia_treedoor_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
It seems the ancient tree doors operate through the fireflies that inhabit the nearby trees. When a tree is infused with amrita, the fireflies appear to carry it to stones above the door, transferring the energy to open the door for an indeterminable amount of time. The acorn doors operate similarly, as acorns grown from trees in the valley possess traces of amrita. What causes all the trees, coniferous and deciduous alike, to grow these acorns?

data.name: field_virginia_wendigo_vo
data.value: Virginia King, May 19th, 1943 <until 4.485> The Susurrians, much like other indigenous peoples, <until 7.935> seem to hold strong cultural value in legendary creatures; <until 12.660> the most notable one being the creature depicted on all these doorways. <until 16.607> It resembles the mythological ‘wendigo’, <until 19.357> a fierce creature with an insatiable desire to consume flesh. <until 24.135> The creature is most often linked with both greed and famine, <until 28.080> acting as a balance of nature. <until 30.540> Why would this creature hold such a strong cultural significance to them? <until 35.115>

data.name: intro_narrator_suitpickup
data.value: <until 14.354> Welcome to the Pathfinder program. <until 17.055> As a Pathfinder, you will be tasked with operating and testing the newly developed L.E.A.F. suit, <until 22.982> as our hard working scientists at Pendulum develop new ways to empower our troops<until 27.524> fighting the war in Europe. <until 30.332> With the power of the L.E.A.F. suit, you will be able to perform unimaginable feats! <until 36.110> Leaping high into the air, <until 39.811> sprinting as quickly as a cheetah, <until 43.881> even manipulating life and death itself <until 45.894> are all part of the many stunts accomplished by the L.E.A.F. suit. <until 50.998> In addition to these marvelous wonders, an audio reel recorder built directly into the suit <until 56.068> allows a Pathfinder to conveniently listen to important intelligence hands free during <until 61.258> training exercises. And don’t forget to keep an ear out for new upgrades available for your suit, <until 67.728> as our scientists continue looking for new ways to improve the fearsome might of the L.E.A.F. suit! <until 74.418> Good luck and safe journey as you test the limits of this amazing new technology! <until 82.068>

data.name: intro_pathfinder_note_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
I could watch these sprites all day. I can’t believe how friendly they are; brave enough to come right up to us. I guess they have no reason to fear us; we aren’t natural predators to them at all.

data.name: intro_pathfiner_raptorsuit_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
It's taken a while, but we finally finished our own Raptor design of the L.E.A.F. suit. If anyone finds out we commandeered a spare suit and altered it outside the military-approved colors, they'll have our necks! We'll keep it hidden away from the top brass and sneak it out once we're sent back home.

data.name: intro_player_canoe
data.value: Useless discount canoeing lessons...

data.name: intro_player_exists
data.value: The Lifeseed actually exists!

data.name: intro_player_fireflies
data.value: Seems like these fireflies react to energy...

data.name: intro_player_lyfeseid

data.name: intro_player_monologue_vo
data.value: - <until 1.900> Hey, looks like I missed you. <until 3.960> I just wanted to wish you luck before you headed out. <until 6.408> I still can’t believe you’re doing this- I mean, hunting down the…what was it? <until 10.227> The “Lifeseed”? <until 11.680> You gotta admit that sounds crazy! I mean, even if this mythological thing <until 15.630> that can shatter worlds, or whatever, actually exists, <until 18.980> what are the chances of you tracking down this ancient relic <until 21.360> in the middle of the Rocky Mountains? <until 23.499> Listen, I know you wanna prove the thing exists, I get that. <until 26.573> It’s an adventure. Hell, it’s your career. <until 28.632> But can’t you do something normal like the rest of us and just backpack Europe or something? <until 33.419> Spend a month in Thailand? But hey, if by some miracle you find this thing <until 38.021> and become the most famous archeologist of all time- <until 41.049> beers are on me. I'll even trade in your tin foil hat for a whip and fedora. <until 45.657> I just really hope all those canoeing lessons pay off. <until 49.392>

data.name: intro_virginia_digsite_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
October 15th, 1944 The North-East dig site is providing a number of clues towards the stonecutting techniques of the ancient inhabitants. The Pathfinders assigned to exploring the site have uncovered a wide array of tools that may have been used. With any luck, we can attempt to reproduce the methodology.

data.name: intro_virginia_logs_tw
data.value:
A page from Virginia King’s logbook:
Table of Contents:
Titan Tree Lifeseed Obelisks Sussurian Step Pyramid Environmental Impact of Military Activity Daemon Behavior

data.name: Intro_virginia_suit_vo
data.value: - <until 4.125> Virginia King, audio journal, June 4th 1941. Shortly after the outbreak of war in Europe, <until 12.548> I was enlisted by the army to study the history of this valley. <until 16.593> The mysterious forest sprites seem to be the last living remnants of the long lost culture <until 21.160> that once lived here. A large number of them seem to inhabit <until 25.260> the North-East sector of the valley, just past the ruins where the Lifeseed, <until 30.174> rumored to possess an Earth-shattering power, was found. <until 35.745> That’s as good a place of any to study them. <until 38.784>

data.name: Intro_virginia_suit2_vo
data.value: The army calls this valley Area 634, but I’ve ascribed a new word for it: <until 7.059> Susurrus. <until 9.225> The beauty of that word seems to rival the majesty of this place. <until 13.665> I suppose that would make its ancient inhabitants officially known as ‘Susurrians’! <until 20.147> To think these ruins have existed here for so long… <until 23.955> they predate any known civilization on the continent, <until 27.874> They seem to have infused the life energy from trees into their infrastructure, but how? <until 33.974>

data.name: Intro_virginia_suit3_vo
data.value: Luckily for me, the military is helping to explore all these ruins <until 4.183> through the soldiers piloting L.E.A.F. suits. They call these soldiers ‘Pathfinders’ <until 8.623> as they can trek through terrain normally inaccessible to someone like me. <until 13.017> Every guy back home is going to want to go joyriding in a L.E.A.F. suit; but until <until 18.044> the military’s project comes to a close, we’re cut off from any contact outside the valley. <until 23.175> I guess the world will have to wait just a bit longer to get their hands on these rides. <until 27.660>

data.name: intro_virginia_titan
data.value: PWsignaturefont<#000000>Titans \t Titans are the names assigned to the giant trees located throughout the valley. All of which are surrounded by a similar type of circular ruins, as though they were worshipped by the ancients of the valley.veteran typewriter<#000000>Pathfinder \t Pathfinders is a designation assigned to soldiers piloting L.E.A.F. suits.

data.name: intro_worker_cargomanifest_tw
data.value:
Cargo manifest - July 29th, 1945
The following items are to be stored securely at the sector 6 storage and handling facility.
- 1 L.E.A.F. suit belonging to Private First Class Edwin Hall - 20 audio recording reels belonging to Virginia King - 3 bundles of documentation

data.name: lake_pathfinder_astra_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
Since the production ramp up, only Pathfinders or approved personnel with emergency life extraction vests are allowed near the Astra facility. This kind of unstable technology is frightening. We’re putting a lot of faith in those scientists that they know what they’re doing. The fact we can barely keep up the orb input it demands is terrifying, do we really need to rush production this much?

data.name: lake_pathfinder_pyramid1_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
I can’t believe we’re the first squad to collect enough medallions to get inside this place! The Landsharks can eat it! To be fair, we owe a lot of it to these weird prototype upgrades we were ordered to test out. We should make this pyramid our new base camp. This magical fires in here spook me a little though.

data.name: lake_pathfinder_pyramid2_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
I can’t wait to get home to my girlfriend. Assuming she’s still my girlfriend… I wish I could just get a letter out to her or something, let her know I’m ok and not to mention all the spectacular things I’m seeing out here. Wait until she gets a look at me in my L.E.A.F. suit!

data.name: lake_player_astra
data.value: So this is the Astra facility

data.name: lake_player_killing
data.value: It's killing everything...

data.name: lake_player_waterrun
data.value: Like skipping a rock across water...

data.name: lake_player_waterrun 2
data.value: I got this

data.name: lake_virginia_architecture_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
The sheer amount of effort the Sussurians put into constructing these architectural marvels is astonishing, it’s a bit hard to understand sometimes. They had clearly grasped forms of advanced mathematics to be able to construct such structures. How long did it take them? How large of a population was sustained here? It would have to be in the thousands.

data.name: lake_virginia_pyramid_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
What purpose did this pyramid serve? The most likely answer is that it acted as a sacred altar. Sacrifice rituals may have been performed at the summit of the structure. I would love to get inside, but I’d rather not damage the pyramid by forcing a way in. I suppose I’ll wait on the Pathfinders, who seem to have made a competition out of it, to gather enough medallions. These guys make a competition out of everything.

data.name: lake_virginia_pyramid_vo
data.value: The pyramid built by the Susurrians served as a ceremonial structure exalting the colossi. <until 7.100> Along with the Titan Tree and daemons, they intertwine to form a mythology. <until 13.630> From what I gathered, <until 15.085> the colossi were once humans who feasted upon the forbidden fruit, <until 19.220> corrupting them into giant monstrosities- <until 22.520> cannibalizing their fellow man and devouring all life within the valley. <until 28.020> Is this a tale of caution? <until 30.550> Are the Susurrians warning us against abusing the power of the Lifeseed? <until 34.700>

data.name: lake_virginia_pyramid2_vo
data.value: While it’s no surprise that Sussurian lore revolves around the fruit of a sacred tree, <until 5.760> a common trope in mythologies, I’m most surprised by how the daemons fit into the lore- <until 12.618> apparently considered wardens of the valley, <until 15.440> charged with returning stolen life back to the valley. <until 18.872> That’s a pretty great burden for such little guys. <until 22.590>

data.name: lake_virginia_wendigo_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
Wendigo mythology is utterly fascinating. Not only do they reflect famine and harsh winters, but also greed and gluttony. Sometimes, even humans overcome with greed could turn into a wendigo, doomed to feast upon the flesh of man for the rest of their lives, never feeling satiated.
Sometimes they are depicted as ever-growing as they consume more and more flesh. Uhhh... will I sleep tonight? Just a myth Virginia, just a myth…

data.name: loadscreen_lvl1
data.value: The Lifeseed is said to contain an incredible, Earth-shattering power. While mostly written off as myth, some archeologists are still determined to track down the elusive item, luring some to incredibly remote locations.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl2
data.value: Soldiers piloting L.E.A.F. suits (Leap Effortlessly through Air Functionality) are known as Pathfinders. Their ability to manipulate life, with running speeds up to 110 km/h, makes them a deadly addition to the battlefield.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl3
data.value: When a Pathfinder dies while wearing a L.E.A.F. suit, they are revived at the cost of other nearby living things. This exciting yet dangerous functionality is known as ‘Quantum Immortality’.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl4
data.value: The Lifeseed found within the valley, produced once every thousand years from the so-called Titan Tree, has been confiscated by the military and taken to the Soma Facility for scientific purposes.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl4b
data.value: The orbs that grow within the valley yield vast deposits of energy. Pendulum aims to win the war by harnessing this energy using the Lifeseed. Bombs created using this energy have the potential to destroy entire cities.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl5
data.value: Pendulum’s bombs rely on Astra’s link with Soma. The Astra extractor pulls in energy, typically from orbs, to deliver to Soma, while the Soma reactor amplifies the energy and sends it back to Astra for weapon creation.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl6
data.value: A member of the Pathfinder division and an on-site anthropologist have been exposed as traitors. During a covert attempt to destroy Astra, security personnel caught the culprits amid the act and placed them under arrest.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl7
data.value: As the Astra facility increases output, the orbs can no longer keep pace. As such, energy will often be pulled from its surroundings. Only those equipped with L.E.A.F. suits may venture near during increased production.

data.name: loadscreen_lvl7b
data.value: In case of emergency, measures are in place to contain any core meltdowns within the Astra Facility. Pumping stations will continuously divert water from the lake into Astra until the core cools, averting fallout.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip1
data.value: Amrita Swarms are composed of amrita-consuming mosquitoes indigenous to the valley. When starved of amrita, the swarms become extremely aggressive.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip10
data.value: Pathfinders explore the valley in squads of 3, each with a designated captain. 5 squads have been assembled and engage in competitions to truly test out the full potential of L.E.A.F. technology in the field.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip11
data.value: The act of ‘Quantum Death’ is a difficult concept to fathom without experiencing it first hand, as the phenomenon is only experienced by the user’s consciousness traveling through parallel worlds.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip12
data.value: The L.E.A.F. suit has been designed to have its parts easily replaced to upgrade the exoskeleton as needed. This allows Pathfinders to adapt quickly to a wide array of challenges.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip2
data.value: The vast and treacherous terrain of the remote regions of the Rocky Mountains proves ideal for covert use. With no inhabitants within hundreds of miles, there is little chance of discovery.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip3
data.value: The Titan Tree found within the valley produces a so-called “Lifeseed” once every thousand years. It is believed the ancient inhabitants of the valley may have worshipped the tree for this reason.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip4
data.value: The valley, known formally as Area 634 to the military, has been ascribed the name “Susurrus” by the anthropological department.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip5
data.value: Energy Capacitor Upgrades are incredibly useful for Pathfinders venturing on long expeditions. As such, a large number of capacitors have been inventoried and distributed throughout the site.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip6
data.value: The ancient inhabitants of the valley appear to have learned to manipulate amrita energy, by using trees themselves to operate heavy stone doorways.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip7
data.value: At just 17 square kilometers, the size of the valley itself is considerably small, particularly in the remote regions of the Rocky Mountains which can stretch for thousands of kilometers.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip8
data.value: An extinction event in the late Pleistocene period resulted in the disappearance of many large mammals and megafauna in North America. Some believe the epicenter of the extinction can be traced to Area 634.

data.name: loadscreen_tooltip9
data.value: The origin of the forest sprites, known as daemons, is unknown to Area 634 researchers. Oddly, their biological make-up appears close to both jellyfish and mammals.
