data.name: reactor_andrew_astra_vo
data.value: The second facility built within the valley, named Astra, works in unison with Soma. <until 5.550> The valley’s orbs are harvested at the Astra facility which then cycles <until 9.395> through the Soma reactor to be amplified and returned to Astra for weapon creation. <until 14.325> The two facilities are interdependent on each other, like yin and yang, to maintain a balance. <until 21.205>

data.name: reactor_andrew_complaining_vo
data.value: That self-righteous anthropologist is stirring up trouble again. <until 4.655> Her moral objections to this project are the last thing I need on my mind. <until 8.564> If it weren’t for the isolation policy, <until 10.700> I’d have her removed from the premises and sent back home! <until 14.000>

data.name: reactor_andrew_einstein_tw
data.value:
Note from Andrew Fisher:
When I met Einstein at Princeton, I couldn’t help but see a hint of Oppenheimer reflected in him. I was astonished by his clairvoyance into the makeup of our universe, viewing the experience of all things natural and spiritual in perfect unison, with the ‘self’ acting as little more than an optical illusion in the perpetual flow of the universe.
When Oppenheimer and I studied Indology under Arthur Ryder, I could see that same compassion and empathy for all living creatures brewing within him.

data.name: reactor_andrew_functionality_vo
data.value: To produce bombs of unparalleled yield, <until 2.930> we rely upon the Lifeseed housed within a reactor found deep underground beneath the Soma Facility. <until 8.720> By harvesting the high energy-yield orbs found within the valley, <until 12.050> we pass their energy through the Lifeseed, which acts as a sort of amplifier, <until 16.850> magnifying the energy to unprecedented levels! <until 19.722> The explosives we create here will dwarf anything the Manhattan Project could ever possibly fathom! <until 26.496>

data.name: reactor_andrew_lifeseed_tw
data.value:
Note from Andrew Fisher:
Tracing the Lifeseed’s location was a simple matter. After years of tracking the epicenter of the Pleistocene extinction event, I was led to this valley’s location. I couldn’t believe my eyes. Upon immediate examination of one of the orbs, I discovered their vast energy potential. With the help of the Pathfinders I was able to locate the Lifeseed within the valley. Oppenheimer won’t believe his ears upon hearing the marvels I’ve accomplished.

data.name: reactor_andrew_pathfinders_vo
data.value: July 3rd, 1943 <until 3.455> Pathfinder is a designation assigned to soldiers piloting L.E.A.F. suits. <until 7.485> Pathfinders are divided into squads of 3. Objectives include testing L.E.A.F. technology <until 12.825> and to aid the anthropological effort as we further explore the ruins of the valley. <until 17.556> As such, Pathfinders are granted incredible speed and agility. <until 21.726> Soldiers piloting L.E.A.F. suits are given the stimulant DX-9 <until 25.856> to exert the energy needed to drive the exoskeleton. <until 29.449> Mark my words; these are the soldiers of the future. <until 34.970>

data.name: reactor_andrew_pendulum_vo
data.value: September 17th, 1942 My name is Andrew Fisher, <until 5.491> Leading Physicist and Head of Project Pendulum. Pendulum is the research and development project <until 10.916> directed by the Army Corps of Engineers to produce a weapon of mass destruction <until 15.646> that can bring an end to the war through the unconditional surrender of our enemies. <until 21.776> In response to the spy-ridden efforts of the Manhattan Project, <until 25.493> headed by my cohort Robert Oppenheimer, Pendulum has been founded under the utmost secrecy <until 32.375> Funds, pride and soldiers' lives are all on the line in a race to win the war, <until 37.774> thus giving rise to the name Pendulum. <until 40.914>

data.name: reactor_andrew_powerouts_tw
data.value:
Note from Andrew Fisher:
Due to the power strain as the reactor ramps up production to meet our increased quota, we’ve experienced frequent power outages. As such, I’ve ordered amrita generators as a backup power source to be temporarily installed throughout the facility. Blackouts should cease to occur.

data.name: reactor_andrew_quantumdeath_vo
data.value: I..I can’t believe it. I’m almost at a loss for words! <until 4.532> This is the discovery of a lifetime, no…no of the 20th century! <until 9.337> Have I found Schrodinger’s cat? This is beyond my wildest imagination! <until 14.194> As a result of the reaction between amrita energy and a Pathinfinder’s own life-force, <until 19.474> they experience what I have dubbed “quantum death”. <until 22.004> When a Pathfinder dies while wearing the suit, <until 24.444> their consciousness branches into a new reality, unharmed. <until 28.075> They achieve quantum immortality! <until 31.574>

data.name: reactor_andrew_quantumdeath2_tw
data.value:
Note from Andrew Fisher:
Effectively, those wearing L.E.A.F. suits gain the ability to deny the actuality of wave function collapse: in other words, the ability to branch through various objective realities as part of the many-world theory of quantum mechanics. With this ability, Pathfinders have visions of themselves dying. Each time this occurs, something nearby dies such as an animal or nearby vegetation.

data.name: reactor_andrew_quantumdeath2_vo
data.value: As we observed with Quantum Death, <until 2.850> it appears that as a trade-off something must forfeit its own life in their stead. <until 7.332> To put it plainly- <until 8.600> if a Pathfinder wearing the L.E.A.F. suit dies through some accident, <until 12.099> their death is traded with the life of a nearby living thing. <until 15.557> They achieve quantum immortality. Until we can circumvent this drawback, <until 21.075> utmost precaution must be used <until 23.995>

data.name: reactor_andrew_quantumdeath3_tw
data.value:
Note from Andrew Fisher:
It was soon discovered that if the Pathfinder has a vision of their own death, it is in fact them actually dying. Instead of remaining dead, they branch into a new wave of reality, whereupon they continue to live, albeit at the cost of an equivalent amount of life within that branch.
To put it plainly, if a Pathfinder wearing the L.E.A.F. suit dies through some accident, their death is traded with the life of a nearby living thing. They achieve quantum immortality.

data.name: reactor_andrew_rampupproduction_vo
data.value: That damned Oppenheimer! <until 2.314> A report just came in stating that Manhattan’s first field test was a sure-fire success. <until 7.472> The explosion yielded 20 kilotons of TNT energy. I know I can outmatch this- <until 12.969> at greater efficiency, but time is running out. I am ordering a 300 percent increase in production <until 19.595> to meet quotas for a megaton blast yield, produced in three days’ time. <until 24.219> But of course, our trump card lies in the Thanatos cannon prototype under development: <until 30.078> its power unlike anything Oppenheimer could possibly fathom. With this technology, <until 35.491> we’ll become the closest thing to gods the world has ever seen! <until 39.340>

data.name: reactor_andrew_samsara_vo
data.value: //Removed That damned Oppenheimer! A report just came in stating that Manhattan’s first field test was a sure-fire success. The explosion yielded 20 kilotons of TNT in energy. I know I can outmatch this- at greater efficiency, but time is running out. Undoubtedly the Secretary of War and the army’s Chief of Staff are all too eager to jump on Oppenheimer’s bandwagon. I have to move fast. I am ordering a 300 percent increase in production to meet quotas for a megaton blast yield, produced in three days’ time.

data.name: reactor_andrew_speedcap_vo
data.value: Our newly developed Pushrod Pistons <until 2.632> will allow Pathfinders to achieve an unprecedented velocity. <until 5.942> By energizing the tunnel rails, <until 8.060> the L.E.A.F. suit should conduct enough energy to reach immense speeds. <until 12.00>

data.name: reactor_andrew_valleylocation_vo
data.value: As a precaution to both Nazi and Soviet espionage, <until 3.970> Pendulum’s location and purpose is unknown to the outside world. <until 8.090> Taking a cue from the Manhattan Project, only a small few know of Pendulum’s purpose, <until 13.085> operating under the guise of an alternative energy project. <until 16.776> As it came to light that Manhattan had been plagued with espionage, <until 20.664> it was agreed upon to shroud Pendulum within the government itself. <until 24.776> All those who know of Pendulum’s true intent are here. Though admittedly extreme, <until 29.726> we can ensure an ironclad umbrella of secrecy. Information can only come in, and none can go out. <until 36.756> As far as anyone outside this valley knows, <until 39.383> Pendulum does not exist. This valley does not exist. <until 46.253>

data.name: reactor_bureaucrat_secret_tw
data.value:
Note from an administrator:
Trying to keep this operation a secret has been an absolute nightmare. Between coordinating surreptitious supply drops, securing illegitimate funds, channeling resources and manpower, to creating thousands of ghost accounts and fake offices to bury the operation from any level of government. Barring someone accidentally stumbling across this location in one of the most remote areas on the planet, there is no chance any one will find us out here.

data.name: reactor_charlotte_psychology_tw
data.value:
Note from Charlotte Smith:
I’ve ran through the annual psychological assessment for all personnel stationed in Area 634. Many are reaching a breaking point in their isolation from friends and family back home, and the work hours demanded from them is taking its toll on morale.
Despite this, most are quite mentally stable. The project lead, Andrew Fisher, does concern me.

data.name: reactor_clark_code1_tw
data.value: Beginning SILENTKEY encrypted message, June 2nd: TZYB3KSB6!TMKUF7IKV,ZSN5K?3E5BZESC6VLE,2UECLVP

data.name: reactor_clark_code2_tw
data.value: Beginning SILENTKEY encrypted message, June 5th: IKV,ZSR3VLE,6E,7,Z5!ZZTR3ILKV5BZ6WZY2 IKSV3VZ6,M!UMVTW7VKTA5K(ZYVP

data.name: reactor_contractor_note_tw
data.value:
Note from a contractor:
Now that the isolation policy is in effect, I’ve found out this is a weapon project of some sort. I still don’t know much, but I hope to find out more. I just wish I could talk to my family back home, let them know I’m doing ok.

data.name: reactor_engineer_mountain_tw
data.value:
Note from an engineer:
Thankfully this mountain is riddled with tunnels and caverns already carved by either the ancient inhabitants here or through natural geologic events. Otherwise, getting the reactor down here would have taken us years. If this thing ever destabilizes, it can hopefully be contained under the massive weight of the mountain.

data.name: reactor_engineer_overheating_tw
data.value:
Note from an engineer:
The strain we’ve been putting on this reactor is beyond safe limits. Ever since the ramp up I feel like I’m risking my life by coming down here for the daily pressure checks. We had better finish up soon, I don’t know how much more the reactor can take.

data.name: reactor_guard_hockey_tw
data.value:
Note from a guard:
Right before being sent out here, I got to see the Maple Leafs win the Stanley Cup. That goal by ol’ Petey Langelle was one to remember. I’d bet anything they’re gonna win the cup again next year. I’d even bet my children on it, they don’t really like me anyhow.

data.name: reactor_guard_note1_tw
data.value:
Note from Private Reilly:
I’ve been ordered to patrol the Soma facility again today. I’ve circled through the same rooms thirty times since noon. At least I get to smile at the cute scientist in the pressure chambers each time. She hasn’t smiled back at me yet… I hope she doesn’t find me creepy.

data.name: reactor_guard_pathfinder_tw
data.value:
Note from a guard:
I’d give anything to be a Pathfinder, but there’s no way I’d ever be eligible unless I suddenly lost 60 pounds. That’ll never happen. Too bad, I bet you I could pick up a lot of girls in those things.

data.name: reactor_hatepun_note_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
I hate that annoying pun guy. I went into storage looking for inert gas to fill the glovebox. He walked by with the last canister in hand and told me it was “argon”. I hate him.

data.name: reactor_intercom_activation_vo
data.value: Warning: Soma reactor deactivated. Fuel link to Astra has been disrupted. <until 6.334> All Area 634 occupants are in danger of life extraction. <until 10.385> Please suspend Astra operations immediately. <until 13.500>

data.name: reactor_intercom_activation2_vo
data.value: Warning: all personal in danger of life extraction. <until 3.690> Please shut down Astra immediately. <until 5.940>

data.name: reactor_intercom_cafeteria_vo
data.value: Attention all personnel: a security breach has been detected. Please vacate the premise at once. Again, all personnel must vacate the premise immediately.

data.name: reactor_intercom_entering soma_vo
data.value: You are now entering the Soma facility. <until 2.338> Please have proper identification ready for verification. <until 5.929> All personnel must provide proper identification. <until 8.998> Failure to do so will result in detention. <until 12.250>

data.name: reactor_intercom_welcome_vo
data.value: Welcome to the Pendulum research and development site. <until 4.085> All personnel must report to the front desk with appropriate security clearance. <until 8.208>

data.name: reactor_jefferson_suspicious_tw
data.value:
Note from a guard:
I've spotted engineers Clarke and Watson suspiciously exchanging notes back and forth every day at lunch. I need to keep an eye on them; they could potentially be Soviet spies.

data.name: reactor_memo_hours_tw
data.value:
Memo:
All personnel are expected to work longer hours during the ramp up in production. If you believe you are unable to perform your duties as expected, please report to a supervisor immediately.

data.name: reactor_memo_reportsuspicious_tw
data.value:
Memo:
Please report any suspicious activity to an officer immediately. Any hesitation could place the entire operation in jeopardy.

data.name: reactor_memo_waste_tw
data.value:
Memo:
Please refrain from wasting office supplies unnecessarily. Stock is running low. Please exhaust all office supplies to their full extent.

data.name: reactor_narrator_projectorpathfinder_vo
data.value: Welcome to the Pathfinder program! You’ve been selected among an elite few to participate in an experimental study to test out Pendulum’s newly designed L.E.A.F. suit. Do you have what it takes to master the marvels of this ground-breaking technology?

data.name: reactor_pathfinder_energy_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
It’s odd to think about what exactly a life is once you’ve experienced quantum death. What exactly are the ingredients that make up my life? My ingredients aren’t really any different than anyone else’s; carbon, calcium, hydrogen, etc. held together with some energy. So what exactly makes me, me?
I guess, if anything, I’m just a pattern. One that forms out of the chaotic blender of matter in the universe, like a whirlpool out of the water, and when I die that pattern simply dissipates back into the cosmos. Are we all the same universe simply expressing itself?

data.name: reactor_pathfinder_jealous_tw
data.value:
Note from Private Matthews:
The way Edwin makes a show with Virginia all the time really makes my teeth grind. Everyone knows that romantic involvement between personnel is prohibited, yet no one does anything about it. Why does he get to run around with a girl while the rest of us sit around and play poker for the 9000th time?

data.name: reactor_player_abandoned
data.value: What happened to everyone?

data.name: reactor_player_active
data.value: How is it still active after all these years?

data.name: reactor_player_astra
data.value: Astra?

data.name: reactor_player_astralife
data.value: The energy is harvested at the Astra facility...

data.name: reactor_player_awe
data.value: The Lifeseed...

data.name: reactor_player_awe2
data.value: This is the great LifeSeed!

data.name: reactor_player_awe3
data.value: I can't believe it

data.name: reactor_player_balance
data.value: ...and linked with Soma to be amplified?

data.name: reactor_player_cannon
data.value: Cannon?

data.name: reactor_player_creature
data.value: The hell was that?

data.name: reactor_player_destabilized
data.value: What the hell is Astra?

data.name: reactor_player_harmvalley
data.value: Was the reactor killing the valley?

data.name: reactor_player_lifeseed
data.value: Time to get the Lifeseed out of that thing

data.name: reactor_player_lifeseedreactor
data.value: An underground reactor...

data.name: reactor_player_reactor
data.value: This thing is huge...

data.name: reactor_player_secrecy
data.value: Is that why no one's been here?

data.name: reactor_player_secrecy2
data.value: Does anyone else know this place exists?

data.name: reactor_player_tracks
data.value: So this should lead down to the reactor...

data.name: reactor_player_uhoh
data.value: Uh oh...

data.name: reactor_player_valley
data.value: Were they harming the valley?

data.name: reactor_player_weapon
data.value: Super Weapons?

data.name: reactor_player_whatnow
data.value: What now?

data.name: reactor_pun_note1_tw
data.value:
Note from researcher Miller:
Today one of the guards patrolling the Soma facility walked by. I asked him if he was keeping an “ion” things. I don’t think he got it.

data.name: reactor_pun_note2_tw
data.value:
Note from researcher Miller:
The other scientists were all talking about atoms. I told them not to trust them since they make up everything. They asked me to leave.

data.name: reactor_pun_note3_tw
data.value:
Note from researcher Miller:
I’ve been trying to think of new puns all day about the stored energy of an object. I think a lot of them have potential.

data.name: reactor_reseacher_autopsy_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The toxicology report came in from the autopsy conducted on the latest Pathfinder fatality. As suspected, an excess of DX-IX led to cardiac arrest. The sooner we circumvent the need for DX-IX, the better.

data.name: reactor_researcher_elderlypathfinder_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Quantum death and immortality using L.E.A.F. technology is a fascinating field of study. Using this tech, a person could live out a full life without fear of an accident cutting it short. Albeit, the use of ‘immortality’ is a misnomer, as the user simply shifts to a new timeline wherein they are still alive, this can only hold true until all practical timelines are exhausted.
For example, an elderly man dying of natural causes is unlikely to shift into a timeline where they do not die as that parallel world is very unlikely to exist.

data.name: reactor_researcher_extinction_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
A large scale extinction event occurred in North America near the end of the Pleistocene period. Interestingly, the epicenter of the extinction seems to stem from this valley’s location. Could Area 634 have anything to do with it?

data.name: reactor_researcher_infrastructure_tw
data.value:
Infrastructure report:
The reactor and thermal diffuser are very unstable and must be located both far apart and underground to ensure any accidental explosions are contained. Large vents are needed to circulate cool air deep into the mountain.
Conveniently, one of the mountains already had ancient tunnels leading deep into the heart of the mountain. This site was chosen for the thermal diffuser and weapons site. The two sites are connected via underground rail to transport materials.

data.name: reactor_researcher_isolation_tw
data.value:
Reminder Notification:
Area 634 Isolation Policy is currently in effect. All vehicles and personnel entering the site can no longer leave until project completion. The rail tunnel and airport will remain closed until that time. All communication is in full lockdown.
Thomas Wilson Head of Pendulum Transportation

data.name: reactor_researcher_leaf_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The L.E.A.F. suit may prove to be the pinnacle feat of Pendulum; the ability to manipulate life and death using the God Hand, the agility, and the ability to circumvent death, all thanks to the amrita energy converted from this valley’s orbs.
We can create the ultimate soldier. The Mark II’s success will herald a new wave of iterations.

data.name: reactor_researcher_lifeextraction_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Depending on the degree of magnitude, certain organisms provide very little amrita energy when targeted by the L.E.A.F. suit’s God Hand. Smaller organisms such as insects, grass, flowers and other less substantial entities provide close to zero energy, thereby affording no value for Pathfinders seeking energy.

data.name: reactor_researcher_lifeseedloop_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The Lifeseed’s ability to amplify energy is incredibly dangerous. If energy passes through too quickly, it will amplify at an exponential rate uncontainable by our conductors and thermal chemical reserves. To ensure we do not blow out the energy circuit, we must mitigate a restricted amount of amrita to pass through at any given time. Typically, only one pass-through is all that the conductors can handle before the energy becomes too immense to possibly contain, reaching upwards of a full petajoule.

data.name: reactor_researcher_megalomaniac_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Fisher is demanding we work nearly nonstop these last few weeks. He comes off as a megalomaniac, constantly reveling in his work. Just look at that Pathfinder statue in the main lobby! I can’t believe we have to take orders from him, without question, during war time.
Surely I can’t be the only one who feels this way. Maybe being stuck in this valley for so long has got the better of him.

data.name: reactor_researcher_megalomaniac2_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
This Fisher guy is out of his mind. A total megalomaniac. Just look at that Pathfinder statue in the main lobby! I can’t believe we all have to take orders from him, unquestionably, during this war time. Surely I can’t be the only one who feels this way.

data.name: reactor_researcher_orbdesk_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
I finally got to see one of those orbs out in the wild while I was on leave for the day. There is something surreal about them. I stared into it for who knows how long…

data.name: reactor_researcher_orbs_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The energy orbs growing here are the key to the valley. Pendulum completely depends on the vast magnitude of energy these orbs contain within them. Regardless of where they came from, they are the key to ending the war.
Through Pendulum, we can harness the so called ‘amrita’ energy of the orbs and release it however we see fit. Oppenheimer’s atomic bomb will pale in comparison to what we can produce here.

data.name: reactor_researcher_powerslugs_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Within the Soma facility, we are surrounded by the amrita fuel slugs extracted from the valley. As such, we tend to be isolated from the effects of the Pathfinder’s quantum death side-effects. I was amazed to one day step out of the facility to see scores of trees dead around me.

data.name: reactor_researcher_protoype_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
I thought the bombs being created were impressive enough, but it’s that new weapon prototype that will undoubtedly steal all the attention. It’s being called ‘Thanatos’.

data.name: reactor_researcher_rampup_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
Why in hell is Fisher making us ramp up production? We’re already working ourselves half to death down here, and now he wants sleep deprived people working round the clock? We’re working on explosives for crying out loud!

data.name: reactor_researcher_sightings_tw
data.value:
Note from a psychologist:
Several guards on night watch have reported large creature sightings. Some of them are a little shaken up by it. It might just be that being stuck out here in the middle of nowhere for so long is finally getting to them. Either way, we’ll need full annual psychological assessments for all personnel in the near future.
Charlotte Smith Psychological Operations

data.name: reactor_scientist_fisherpraise_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
That no good Simmons is sucking up to Fisher again. He’s always first to volunteer for assignments, which is no surprise as Fisher can hardly enter a room without him following. He’s not even all that smart, just great at agreeing with everything Fisher has to say. Is that how you get ahead these days?

data.name: reactor_scientist_screams_vo
data.value:
//Removed
July 17th 1945, production capacity has peaked, with all cores showing signs of thermal strain. As per emergency precautions, reducing output back to sustainable default levels. Additional cooling units- *Strange creature noise* What was that? *Sound of someone running, screaming* What the hell! *Alarm sound goes off, creature noises are heard in large numbers, very loud* *Screaming from multiple people, chaos and running* -Suddenly cuts out-

data.name: reactor_silentkey_decryption_tw
data.value: A=K B=D C=G D=F E=I F=, G=" H=) I=W J=: K=A L=H M=E N=. O=J P=? Q=Q R=! S=N T=L U=R V=T W=Y X=' Y=U Z=O .=X ,=S ?=M !=C '=P "=Z (=B )=V :=( Numbers = Spaces

data.name: reactor_tradesmen_note_tw
data.value:
Note from a boilermaker:
They told us we’re building some sort of alternative energy facility here, but little else. Tradesmen are only allowed in certain areas at certain times for certain jobs. They’re keeping us completely in the dark, having us all focus on a single task at a time rather than giving us any hints into the big picture. What are they hiding from us?

data.name: reactor_virginia_forestplight_vo
data.value: The valley…it’s suffering. <until 5.074> The natural life here seems to be slowly dwindling. <until 9.280> Edwin thinks I’m crazy, but I see it becoming… quieter. <until 15.451> Are we gradually killing this place? <until 18.031>

data.name: reactor_virginia_frustrated_vo
data.value: - <until 1.335> Fisher’s all but ignoring any of my pleas to slow down what they’re doing to the valley. <until 7.408> We’re speeding blindly past the point of no return. <until 11.268> Edwin can see it too. The animals have all vanished or died off, <until 17.578> trees are withering away, even those Amrita Swarms have become incredibly aggressive… <until 25.004> and the daemons… What will happen to them? <until 32.703> With word coming in over broadcasts of victory in Europe, <until 35.757> what’s the point in this? <until 37.920>

data.value: Beginning SILENTKEY encrypted message, June 1st: VLE,3E,6K7VM,VN5!TKUAMF3BZ5WZY6!Z'WP

data.name: reactor_worker _coffee_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
Ralph, I saw you take a sip of my coffee this morning. And it wasn’t the first time either. You know how scarce coffee is getting around here. Please stop sipping my coffee.
-Frederick

data.name: reactor_worker_contractors_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
Most of the contractors who help construct this place have since been sent back home, having no idea where exactly in the mountains they had been working. As far as they knew, they were simply building an alternative energy research compound. The army was careful to hide the orbs, ruins and sprites from the contractors, limiting where they could go and what they could see.

data.name: reactor_worker_pencils_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
I’m getting real sick of your attitude Ralph. I saw you sneak into my office to steal pencils again. I’m running low and really need them for my work. The next supply drop isn’t until the spring. Stop stealing my pencils, please and thank you.
-Frederick

data.name: reactor_worker_ruins_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
Whoever these people were that once lived in this valley sure went through a lot of trouble carving out all these giant colossi everywhere, even in these tunnels. Must have been pretty important to them, digging out passageways through the middle of a mountain ain’t easy!

data.name: reactor_worker_supplydrops_tw
data.value:
Note from a worker:
We better finish up this project soon. Those supply drops are only scheduled to arrive for a few more months. Otherwise, due to the isolation policy, we’re on our own. The pilots know nothing of this operation other than their orders to drop off supplies to this location until the end of this year. I think they were told this is for a mining operation. No wonder Fisher is going mad over our timelines.

data.name: tooltip_generic
data.value: This is a placeholder tool tip. You can write various tooltips to the loading screen in order to show the player new information.

data.name: tutorial_acorn_pickup
data.value: Collect enough acorns to gain access through certain ancient doorways.

data.name: tutorial_ancient_artifact
data.value: These medallions are said to be used to access an ancient pyramid. Collect enough pieces to gain entry to its chambers.

data.name: tutorial_bouncing_orbs
data.value: Bounce Membrane upgrade allows energy to bounce off hard surfaces.

data.name: tutorial_damage_reduction
data.value: Take less of a hit to your energy reserves through damage with the radiator block.

data.name: tutorial_double_jump
data.value: Get to higher and further areas by double jumping with the Icarus Boost upgrade. Each boost costs 1 unit of energy.

data.name: tutorial_doublejump_nullify
data.value: The Icarus Boost damper nullifies its energy cost.

data.name: tutorial_enemy_behaviour
data.value: Ward off enemies using daemon scent.

data.name: tutorial_energy_canister
data.value: The energy canister increases your suit’s energy capacity by four units.

data.name: tutorial_energy_capacitor
data.value: Energy capacity is increased with Capacitor upgrades. Find four to complete an energy canister.

data.name: tutorial_energy_efficiency
data.value: Use energy more efficiently with the Energy Damper upgrade! L.E.A.F. functionality now requires less energy to perform abilities.

data.name: tutorial_energy_flare
data.value: Light your path by either shooting energy like a flare, or into certain objects such as fungi or generators, to illuminate an area.

data.name: tutorial_generator_power
data.value: Generators used by the army have been designed to accept amrita energy. Try activating one with your suit's energy.

data.name: tutorial_give_energy
data.value: Many items, both ancient and modern, have been designed to accept amrita energy for various uses.

data.name: tutorial_golden_acorns
data.value: By giving life to trees, there is a chance one or more golden acorns will drop.

data.name: tutorial_health_pack
data.value: Use amrita packs to restore a small amount of energy to your suit.

data.name: tutorial_hookshot_nullify
data.value: The Viper Coil damper nullifies its energy cost.

data.name: tutorial_insect_swarm
data.value: Beware of Amrita Swarms. They can be pacified with life energy. Damage from their attacks affects your energy count. Damage at zero energy results in death.

data.name: tutorial_killer_soma
data.value: Killer soma are aggressive, and ignite flammable vapour when stimulated as a defence mechanism.

data.name: tutorial_lifeseed
data.value: The Lifeseed amplifies any energy that passes through it. More testing needs to be conducted to further learn of its effects.

data.name: tutorial_open_wavefunction_01
data.value: When there is not enough life to draw from to revive yourself, you end up in a limbo state called ‘Samsara’.

data.name: tutorial_open_wavefunction_02
data.value: This state is a cross-section of branching realities. Collect energy from Pathfinders who have died in the past to branch off into a new reality where you are alive.

data.name: tutorial_orbs_01
data.value: The L.E.A.F. suit's energy can be replenished by orbs found growing in the valley.

data.name: tutorial_poison_plants
data.value: Ya-te-veo, meaning "I see you", is a carnivorous plant whose spore feeds on amrita energy. Avoid venturing within its range.

data.name: tutorial_quantum_death_01
data.value: The L.E.A.F. suit’s Quantum Death functionality allows the user to return to life after dying.

data.name: tutorial_quantum_death_02
data.value: But life must be traded for life. The more you die, the more the valley will die around you until it is fully deadened. Without enough life in the valley, you cannot be revived.

data.name: tutorial_rail_running
data.value: Feed off the energy conduction of powered rails to travel faster

data.name: tutorial_raptor_suit
data.value: The Raptor L.E.A.F. suit reflects the pride the venturesome Raptor squad takes in their Pathfinder motif.

data.name: tutorial_revitalize_valley
data.value: To prevent the valley from fully dying, it can be revitalized by returning life to once living things.

data.name: tutorial_run_jump
data.value: Use forward momentum to jump a further distance.

data.name: tutorial_run_slope
data.value: Run down slopes to gain momentum to jump higher and further.

data.name: tutorial_slope_speed
data.value: Increase velocity by running down slopes.

data.name: tutorial_speedcap_increase
data.value: Get where you need faster with the Pushrod Piston maximum velocity upgrade.

data.name: tutorial_storage_cells
data.value: No trees or orbs nearby? Take energy from Storage Cells to restock your reserves.

data.name: tutorial_surface_break_01
data.value: Cracked surfaces can be broken through by landing on them from high above.

data.name: tutorial_surface_break_02
data.value: Remember, dropping from large heights can break through cracked surfaces.

data.name: tutorial_take_energy
data.value: Life can also be taken from nearby living things rich in energy, such as a tree or animal, to replenish your suit. Less robust lifeforms, such as blades of grass, provide no value.

data.name: tutorial_titan_tree
data.value: Titan Trees, found growing throughout the valley, have large obelisks at the tips of its roots.

data.name: tutorial_tree_door
data.value: Ancient doorways are activated by a tree's life energy. Look out for fireflies that inhabit these trees.

data.name: tutorial_trees_life
data.value: Energy stored within the L.E.A.F. suit, known as "amrita", can be given to once living things.

data.name: tutorial_viper_coil
data.value: Swing yourself up to new places with the Viper Coil upgrade, allowing Pathfinders to latch onto deadeye crane blocks. Each use costs 1 unit of energy.

data.name: tutorial_wall_running
data.value: Run along magnetic wall surfaces with the Magnetic Core upgrade.

data.name: tutorial_water_death
data.value: L.E.A.F. suits are very heavy equipment: this makes water incredibly dangerous.

data.name: tutorial_water_running
data.value: Lake Skipper upgrade allows Pathfinders to run across water for a limited duration. Your speed will increase as you run.

data.name: valley_andrew_doublejump_vo
data.value: Andrew Fisher, lead Physicist, <until 2.310> beginning Pathfinder testing on the Icarus Boost upgrade. <until 5.968> The secondary boost augmentation to the L.E.A.F. suit should allow a Pathfinder to <until 9.304> jump twice in sequence through the air, increasing the height and distance of their leap drastically. <until 15.574> Report any defects to a commanding officer immediately. <until 18.574>

data.name: valley_edwin_acorns_tw
data.value:
Note from Edwin Hall:
I got 30 golden acorns, finally! I’ve been growing trees all afternoon to get them. I just need a few more to complete exploration of this quadrant.

data.name: valley_edwin_virginia_tw
data.value:
Note from Edwin Hall:
I have a great idea to sweep Virginia off her feet. I managed to steal a bottle of wine from the Kitchen. I’m going to invite her out to the rooftops and watch the aurora.
I’m one hell of a romantic!

data.name: valley_intercom_elevator_vo
data.value: Reminder: You are approaching a high security area. <until 3.792> All Area 634 personnel must present proper identification badges upon entry. <until 8.875> Unauthorized personnel will be detained and questioned. <until 12.300>

data.name: valley_memo_generator_tw
data.value: Memo: In case of power shortage, please use amrita generators.

data.name: valley_memo_wall_tw
data.value: Caution: Monument wall unstable. Blunt force may cause collapse.

data.name: valley_objective_returntitantree
data.value: Return to explore the Titan Tree

data.name: valley_pathfinder_acorns_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
Those acorn doors are pretty neat. Captain Hall ordered us to collect enough acorns to open all the passageways in sector 3. I’m about halfway there.

data.name: valley_pathfinder_soma_tw
data.value:
Note from a Pathfinder:
Just my luck, first day on a training run and what do I run into? One of those Amrita Swarms they kept on warning us about in the briefing. The darned thing nearly killed me! Thank goodness I had enough energy to pacify the swarm. What on Earth made them so damn aggressive?

data.name: valley_player_facility
data.value: Must be atop that elevator shaft outside...

data.name: valley_player_hole
data.value: Could the Lifeseed be down there?

data.name: valley_player_lifeseed
data.value: So that tree produces a Lifeseed?

data.name: valley_researcher_soma_tw
data.value:
Note from a researcher:
The Amrita Swarms indigenous to the valley are incredibly aggressive. It’s advisable to maintain a considerable distance between oneself and the swarm; otherwise it will send a wave of attack drones towards the victim. Like a bee’s defense, the swarms will suicide themselves to protect the rest of the cluster.

data.name: valley_virginia_anthropology_tw
data.value:
M.1098.457.821
Lifeseed Cradle
Organic structure housing embryonic plant

data.name: valley_virginia_doublejump_vo
data.value: - <until 0.140> How did this civilization take hold so far north? The land here isn’t arable, <until 6.103> yet the population that lived here was clearly sedentary in nature. <until 10.031> This leads me to believe this place was used as a sacred ground. <until 14.531> Are these monuments to the mythical cannibal giants of native lore, the Si-teh-cah? <until 20.521>

data.name: valley_virginia_floweroflife_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
The Flower of Life…such a familiar, reoccurring pattern found in most major religions. I shouldn’t be surprised to find it here. Some believe it is the visual representation of life that runs through all organic things, or even the composition of the universe as a whole. The Kabbalah’s Tree of Life is thought to be derived from this pattern. I find it fascinating how such a symbol can be found across the globe, from Syria to India, from the temple of Osiris to Westminster Abbey. It’s a much smaller world than we tend to tell ourselves.

data.name: valley_virginia_floweroflife_vo
data.value: The Flower of Life… such a familiar, reoccurring pattern found in most major religions. <until 7.913> I shouldn’t be surprised to find it here. <until 11.595> Some believe it is the visual representation of life that runs through all organic things, or <until 17.859> even the composition of the universe as a whole. <until 21.014> The Kabbalah’s Tree of Life is thought to be derived from this pattern. <until 25.823> It’s fascinating how such a symbol can be found across the globe, from Syria to India, <until 31.933> from the temple of Osiris to Westminster Abbey. <until 35.706> It’s a much smaller world than we tend to tell ourselves. <until 40.050>

data.name: valley_virginia_lifeseed_vo
data.value: According to legend, the Lifeseed is said to be a bringer of death on a global scale, <until 6.082> splintering the Earth into fragments. Such end time scenarios are common across mythologies, <until 13.241> from the Apocalypse to Ragnarok. <until 16.621> However, it’s unusual for the event to surround a particular object- <until 20.251> especially one acquired by mortals. <until 24.151>

data.name: valley_virginia_olmec_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
The origin of this valley’s ancient inhabitants continues to elude me. They seem to have coexisted with the mysterious forest sprites. I find loose hints of Mesoamerican civilizations, such as the Olmec with their renowned colossal head stone sculptures dating back to 900 BC. Strangely though, the Olmec civilization was much younger and located no less than five thousand kilometers away from here.

data.name: valley_virginia_olmec_vo
data.value: The origin of this valley’s inhabitants continues to elude me. <until 5.304> They seem to have coexisted with the mysterious forest sprites. <until 10.112> I find loose hints of Mesoamerican civilizations, such as the Olmec with their renowned colossal <until 16.640> head stone sculptures dating back to 900 BC. Strangely though, the Olmec civilization was <until 24.012> much younger and located no less than five thousand kilometers away from here. <until 29.192>

data.name: valley_virginia_orbs_vo
data.value: Just what are these glowing orbs that everyone is making a fuss over? <until 5.495> They’re absolutely beautiful. They seem to grow randomly throughout the valley. <until 11.155> I know nothing about them, other than that they are indigenous to this valley <until 14.450> and the army is using their energy for their war project. <until 18.169> That’s about as much as they’ll tell me. It’s such a shame… <until 23.760> I wish they would just let them be. <until 26.715> But I suppose it’s the whole reason we’re here to begin with. <until 31.095>

data.name: valley_virginia_plesiosaur_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
I couldn’t believe my eyes upon discovering a perfectly preserved Plesiosaur fossil here within the valley. I wonder how it got here. How long as it been frozen in time, untouched by the outside world within this cavern? With the presence of primal spears nearby, I could swear this creature was lured here to be hunted. But there’s no way that’s even remotely possible! I wonder what other creatures once lurked within these underwater caverns?

data.name: valley_virginia_pyramid_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
While pyramids are common throughout Mesoamerica, I still couldn’t believe my eyes seeing one such structure here in the valley. Thankfully the military had the decency to build one of their grotesque facilities a few hundred meters away. Apparently the Pathfinders are seeking a way to get in by gathering artifacts.

data.name: valley_virginia_somaswarm_vo
data.value: If there’s one thing I could do without in this valley, it’s those damn Amrita Swarms <until 5.438> that seem to infect this place! They aren’t so bad when they’re calm, <until 10.235> but when they’re starved of amrita energy, they become incredibly aggressive, <until 15.447> sending waves of drones towards intruders in suicidal attacks. <until 20.728> They seem to be becoming angrier the longer we’re here. <until 24.888>

data.name: valley_virginia_sprites_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
My mother would tell me stories of daemons as ghostly and benevolent nature spirits. That name seems fitting. It will have to do for now until a zoologist can classify the forest sprites more appropriately.

data.name: valley_virginia_sprites_vo
data.value: - <until 0.250> The playful little sprites of this valley, which I’ve come to call "daemons", are so lively. <until 6.531> I‘ve done my best to study their behaviors, but without a zoologist on site, <until 11.217> I’m mostly coming up dry. <until 14.117> They’re completely harmless so the army tends to ignore them as they go about their research. <until 19.637> I wonder if the world would clamor to have these daemons as pets. <until 24.028> I’m sure my mother could use one… better than all those feral cats in her backyard anyways. <until 30.528>

data.name: valley_virginia_sprites2_hw
data.value: <font>jerry_b4s_handwriting</font><size=0.25><#000000>What should I call them? My mother would tell me stories of daemons as ghostly and benevolent nature spirits. Yes, daemons. I suppose that will do until a zoologist can classify them more appropriately! </size></color>

data.name: valley_virginia_susurrus_vo
data.value: //Removed The army calls this valley Area 634: such a cold, mechanical name with no testament to the beauty of this place. In my research, I’ve ascribed my own word for it: Susurrus. The beauty of that word seems to rival the majesty of this place. It seems fitting given the calm and soothing nature of the breeze. Susurrus- I suppose that would make it’s ancient inhabitants officially known as ‘Susurrians!’. A little hard to pronounce…but isn’t that what makes it sound scientific?

data.name: valley_virginia_titantree_tw
data.value:
Note from Virginia King:
Sacred trees are common in mythologies around the world, typically acting as symbols of growth, decay and resurrection. Some act as concepts, such as the world tree Yggdrasil of Norse mythology, which provided a map for the composition of the universe, acting as a link between Heaven, Earth, and the Underworld. But more recently in Christian belief, the tree of life represents the immaculate state of humanity before its exposure to original sin causing its fall.

data.name: valley_virginia_titantree_vo
data.value: //removed Sacred trees are common in mythologies around the world, typically acting as symbols of growth, decay and resurrection. Some act as concepts, such as the world tree Yggdrasil of Norse mythology, which provided a map for the composition of the universe, acting as a link between Heaven, Earth, and the Underworld. But more recently in Christian belief, the tree of life represents the immaculate state of humanity before its exposure to original sin causing its fall.

data.name: valley_virginia_titantree2_vo
data.value: Given how rarely a Lifeseed is produced, I was so excited when I discovered there was one found <until 5.559> in the valley. Apparently the military was just as excited, as they immediately confiscated it <until 12.454> to study in the Soma Facility on the mountaintop. They won’t let me anywhere near it. <until 18.400>

data.name: valley_virginia_titantreename_vo
data.value: It’s clear to me that the natives of the valley worshipped the giant tree here…almost as a deity. <until 6.876> Great lengths were taken to construct obelisks around this tree, <until 11.200> which the ancients used to help grow it. <until 14.168> I’ve begun to use the term ‘Titan Tree’ to designate this species. <until 19.258> According to my interpretations, once every thousand years <until 23.350> the Titan Tree will produce the mythological and famed ‘Lifeseed’, <until 27.963> said to possess the power to shatter the world into fragments. <until 32.492> No wonder the military is so interested in this place! <until 35.022>
